description: Collision avoidance is a critical challenge in autonomous robotics, where robots must navigate and operate safely in dynamic environments. This involves detecting and responding to obstacles in real-time to prevent accidents and ensure smooth operation.
you_have_this_if: Your robot frequently encounters unexpected obstacles.
You are developing robots for environments with changing conditions.
Your current collision avoidance system is not adapting well to new scenarios.
You need to enhance the decision-making process of your robot based on user feedback.
You are facing challenges in training your robot with diverse datasets.

approaches.best_for: when developing autonomous robots that operate in dynamic environments and require rapid adaptation to new obstacles.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach balances the need for adaptability with the complexity of integrating human feedback.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to quickly adapt your robot to new and unforeseen obstacles while incorporating user input.

start_here: Start with Human-in-the-loop transfer learning as it allows for rapid adaptation to new environments and enhances decision-making through user feedback.
